net_amount_3m.description: The net amount of the transactions for this category in the last three months (calculated as the total incoming - total outgoing transactions for this category).

category_inflow_ratio_3m.description:
The ratio of `net_amount_3m` divided by the sum of all incoming categorized transactions (including the current category) for the same period.

Note: If there are no inflow transactions for the period, this value will return `null`.

trend_3m.description: The net category transaction trend (incoming - outgoing transactions for the category) for the period.

accounts.description: An array of Belvo-generated account numbers (UUIDs) that were used during the risk insights analysis. If no accounts were found, we return an empty array.

items.description: The Belvo-generated ID for the account.

category_metrics.description:
An array of aggregate metrics regarding the transaction categories and subcategories that Belvo has identified within the user's transaction history.

In the array, Belvo only returns categories that have been identified.

updated_at.description: The ISO-8601 timestamp of when the employment metrics calculation was last updated.

reference_date.description:
The reference_date your provided in your request. If you didn't provide one, this field will return `null`, indicating that the calculations are performed up until the date of the request.

**Note:** All calculations are relative to this date.

current_employer_count.description: The number of employers the individual has right now.

base_salary_last.description: The user's latest base salary. If `current_status` is `EMPLOYED`, this is the user's current base salary.

weeks_employed_last_job.description: The number of weeks the user was employed in their last job. If `current_status` is `EMPLOYED`, then this field indicates the number of weeks the user has been employed with his current job.

weeks_since_last_job.description: The number of weeks since their last job. If the value of this field is `0`, this indicates that the user is currently employed.

weeks_employed_total.description:
The total number of weeks the user has been employed, according to the institution.

> **Note:**
>
> In the case that the user is employed at two or more places at the same time, we still calculate those weeks as one week. For example, if a user has three concurrent jobs for a month, this is calculated as 4 weeks.

weeks_with_multiple_employers.description: The number of the weeks that the individual has had more than one employer at the same time.

employer_count.description: The total number of employers the user has had. Useful to indicate employment stability over the course of their lifetime.

unique_employer_count.description:
The number of unique employers that the individual has had.

> **Note:**
>
> If the user left one company and returned, for example, six months later to the same company, this is counted as one employer.

employers_per_year.description:
Number of employers per year. Useful to indicate employment stability over the course of a year.

> **Note:**
>
> If the user left one company and returned, for example, six months later to the same company, this is counted as one employer.

weeks_between_jobs.description: The total number of weeks the individual was unemployed.

max_weeks_between_jobs.description: The maximum number of weeks that the individual was unemployed.

increases_last_job.description:
The total number of salary increases the user had in their last job. If `current_status` is `EMPLOYED`, this refers to the user's current job.

> **Note:**
>
> For all salary increases or decreases, we only take into account those where the change in salary is greater than 2%.

decreases_last_job.description: The total number of salary increases the user had in their last job. If `current_status` is `EMPLOYED`, this refers to the user's current job.

increases_after_change.description: The total number of salary increases between the individual's penultimate job and the last (or current) job.

decreases_after_change.description: The total number of salary decreases between the individual's penultimate job and the last (or current) job.

increases_overall.description: The total number of salary increases throughout the individual's working career.

decreases_overall.description: The total number of salary decreases throughout the individual's working career.

increases_1y.description: The total number of salary increases throughout the individual's last year (YTD).

decreases_1y.description: The total number of salary decreases throughout the individual's last year (YTD).

increases_3y.description:
The total number of salary increases throughout the individual's last three years.

> **Note:**
>
>  If the individual's working career is less than three years, we return `null`.

decreases_3y.description:
The total number of salary decreases throughout the individual's last three years.

> **Note:**
>
>  If the individual's working career is less than three years, we return `null`.

increases_5y.description:
The total number of salary increases throughout the individual's last five years.

> **Note:**
>
>  If the individual's working career is less than five years, we return `null`.

decreases_5y.description:
The total number of salary decreases throughout the individual's last five years.

> **Note:**
>
>  If the individual's working career is less than five years, we return `null`.

yearly_change_1y.description: The individual's salary percentage change for the last year (YTD).

yearly_change_3y.description:
The individual's salary percentage change for the last three years.

> **Note:**
>
>  If the individual's working career is less than three years, we return `null`.

yearly_change_5y.description:
The individual's salary percentage change for the last five years.

> **Note:**
>
>  If the individual's working career is less than five years, we return `null`.

min_monthly_salary_1y.description: The individual's minimum monthly salary for the last year.

min_monthly_salary_3y.description: The individual's minimum monthly salary for the last three years.

min_monthly_salary_5y.description: The individual's minimum monthly salary for the last five years.

average_monthly_salary_1y.description: The individual's average monthly salary for the last year.

average_monthly_salary_3y.description: The individual's average monthly salary for the last three years.

average_monthly_salary_5y.description: The individual's average monthly salary for the last five years.

max_monthly_salary_1y.description: The individual's maximum monthly salary for the last year.

max_monthly_salary_3y.description: The individual's maximum monthly salary for the last three years.

max_monthly_salary_5y.description: The individual's maximum monthly salary for the last five years.

FinancialStatementBalanceSheetCurrentAss.description: The current assets of the company for the given year.

cash_and_equivalents.description: The total amount of cash and cash equivalents, including currency, bank accounts, and other liquid investments that can be quickly converted to cash.

short_term_investments.description: The value of investments that are expected to be liquidated into cash within one year, such as marketable securities.

accounts_receivable.description: The amount owed by customers for sales made on credit, expected to be received within a short period.

notes_receivable.description: The value of written promissory notes received from customers or others, promising to pay a specified amount by a certain date.

other_debtors.description: The total amounts due from various other debtors, excluding accounts and notes receivable.

bad_debt_provision.description: The estimated amount of receivables that are expected to be uncollectible, often referred to as allowance for doubtful accounts.

tax_recoverable.description: The amount of tax payments that can be recovered from tax authorities.

inventory.description: The total value of goods available for sale, raw materials, work-in-progress, and finished products.

prepaid_expenses.description: The amount paid in advance for goods or services to be received in the future, such as insurance premiums or rent.

assets_available_for_sale.description: The value of non-current assets that are available for sale but not yet sold, such as surplus equipment or property.

total.description: The sum of all current assets, representing the total value of assets expected to be converted into cash or used within one year.

FinancialStatementBalanceSheetNonCurrent.description: The non-current assets of the company, which are long-term investments or property not easily converted into cash, for the given year.

property_plant_and_equipment.description: The total value of property, plant, and equipment owned by the company, including land, buildings, machinery, and vehicles, used for long-term operations.

accumulated_depreciation_and_amortizatio.description: Total accumulated depreciation and amortization, representing the cumulative allocation of the cost of non-current assets over the period they are expected to provide economic benefits.

long_term_accounts_receivable.description: The amount owed by customers for sales made on credit, expected to be received after one year.

prepayment_to_suppliers.description: The amount paid in advance to suppliers for goods or services to be received in the future, expected to be utilized over the long term.

goodwill.description: The value of intangible assets that arise from the acquisition of other companies, representing the premium paid over the fair value of net assets acquired.

intangible_assets.description: The total value of intangible assets owned by the company, such as patents, trademarks, and copyrights, with useful lives extending beyond one year.

investments_in_associates.description: The value of investments in other companies in which the company has significant influence but not control, typically represented by ownership of 20-50% of the associate's voting shares.

long_term_financial_instruments.description: The value of financial instruments that are expected to be held for more than one year, such as bonds, debentures, and long-term loans.

total.description: The sum of all non-current assets, representing the total value of assets expected to be used or held for more than one year.

FinancialStatementBalanceSheetCurrentLia.description: The current liabilities of the company, expected to be settled within the given year.

bank_loans.description: The total amount of loans borrowed from banks or financial institutions, expected to be repaid within one year.

accounts_payable.description: The amount owed to suppliers for goods or services purchased on credit, expected to be paid within a short period.

notes_payable.description: The value of written promissory notes issued to suppliers or others, promising to pay a specified amount by a certain date.

financial_instruments.description: The value of financial instruments that are expected to be liquidated into cash within one year, such as bonds, debentures, and short-term loans.

other_creditors.description: The total amounts due to various other creditors, excluding accounts and notes payable.

income_tax_payable.description: The amount of income tax that is owed to tax authorities, expected to be paid within a short period.

customer_advances.description: The total amount received in advance from customers for goods or services to be delivered in the future, expected to be utilized within one year.

provisions.description: The estimated amount set aside for future liabilities or losses, such as warranties, legal claims, or restructuring costs.

taxes_payable.description: The total amount of taxes owed to tax authorities, expected to be paid within a short period.

total.description: The sum of all current liabilities, representing the total value of obligations expected to be settled within one year.

FinancialStatementBalanceSheetNonCurrent.description: The non-current liabilities of the company, which are long-term obligations not due within the given year.

long_term_accounts_payable.description: The amount owed to suppliers for goods or services purchased on credit, expected to be paid after one year.

long_term_financial_instruments.description: The value of financial instruments that are expected to be held for more than one year, such as bonds, debentures, and long-term loans.

deferred_revenue.description: The amount received in advance from customers for goods or services to be delivered in the future, expected to be recognized as revenue over the long term (such as rent).

contributions_for_future_capital_increas.description: The total contributions received from shareholders or other investors for future capital increases, expected to be utilized over the long term.

deferred_income_tax.description: The amount of income tax that is deferred to future periods, expected to be paid after one year.

employee_benefits.description: The total amount of benefits owed to employees, such as pensions, gratuities, and other post-employment benefits, expected to be settled over the long term.

long_term_provisions.description: The estimated amount set aside for future liabilities or losses, such as warranties, legal claims, or restructuring costs, expected to be settled after one year.

total.description: The sum of all non-current liabilities, representing the total value of obligations expected to be settled after one year.

FinancialStatementBalanceSheetEquity.description: The equity of the company, representing the residual interest in the assets after deducting liabilities.

stockholders_equity.description: The total value of shares issued by the company, representing the ownership interest of shareholders in the business.

future_capital_contributions.description: The funds received from shareholders that are specifically designated for future capital increases or investments.

legal_reserve.description: The statutory reserve mandated by law, typically set aside from profits, to provide financial protection against future losses or obligations.

capital_update_excess.description: The surplus resulting from adjustments made to equity capital, often due to inflation or the revaluation of assets.

capital_update_insufficiency.description: The deficit resulting from adjustments made to equity capital, often due to inflation or the revaluation of assets.

capital_reserve.description: The equity reserve derived from non-operating activities, such as gains from asset revaluations or certain capital transactions.

share_premium_on_stock_sales.description: The excess amount received by a company when shares are issued at a price above their nominal (par) value.

retained_earnings.description: The accumulated profits or losses of the company that have not been distributed to shareholders as dividends.

other_comprehensive_income.description: The gains or losses that are not included in net income but are reported directly in equity, such as unrealized gains on investments or foreign currency translation adjustments.

controlling_interest.description: The ownership interest in the company held by the parent entity or majority shareholders, representing the controlling stake in the business.

non_controlling_interest.description: The ownership interest in the company held by minority shareholders, representing the non-controlling stake in the business.

total.description: The sum of share capital, retained earnings, other comprehensive income, controlling interest, and non-controlling interest, representing the total equity of the company.

FinancialStatementBalanceSheet.description: The balance sheet detailing the company's assets, liabilities, and equity for the given year.

FinancialStatementIncomeStatement.description: The income statement detailing the company's revenues, expenses, and profits for the given year.

net_revenue.description:
The total revenue generated by the company from its core business operations, excluding any deductions for discounts, returns, or allowances.

> **Note**: `domestic_sales` +  `foreign_sales` will not sum to the `net_revenue` due to the exclusion of discounts, returns, and allowances.

domestic_sales.description: The revenue generated by the company from sales of goods or services within its home country.

foreign_sales.description: The revenue generated by the company from sales of goods or services in foreign countries.

materials_used.description: The total cost of materials used or traded by the company during the reporting period.

cost_of_goods_sold.description: The total cost incurred by the company to produce or purchase the goods sold during the reporting period.

cost_of_services_sold.description: The total cost incurred by the company to provide the services sold during the reporting period.

gross_profit.description: The difference between net revenue and the total cost of goods and services sold, representing the profit earned from core business operations before deducting operating expenses.

gross_loss.description: The negative difference between net revenue and the total cost of goods and services sold, representing the loss incurred from core business operations before deducting operating expenses.

operating_expenses.description: The total expenses incurred by the company in its normal operating activities, including selling, general, and administrative expenses.

operating_income.description: The profit earned from core business operations after deducting operating expenses, but before considering interest, taxes, and other non-operating items.

operating_loss.description: The loss incurred from core business operations after deducting operating expenses, but before considering interest, taxes, and other non-operating items.

financial_result.description: The net result of financial activities, including interest income, interest expense, and other financial gains or losses.

income_statement_financial_gains.description: The total positive financial income, including interest income, foreign exchange gains, and other gains from financing activities. This value must always be positive.

income_statement_financial_costs.description: The total financial expenses, including interest expenses, foreign exchange losses, and other costs incurred from financing activities. This value must always be negative.

equity_in_earnings_of_affiliates.description: The company's share of the profit or loss in its associates, entities over which it has significant influence but not control.

income_before_taxes.description: The profit earned before accounting for income tax expenses.

loss_before_taxes.description: The loss incurred before accounting for income tax expenses.

income_taxes.description: The total amount of income tax expenses incurred during the reporting period.

income_from_continuing_operations.description: The profit earned from the company's ongoing business operations after deducting operating expenses and taxes.

loss_from_continuing_operations.description: The loss incurred from the company's ongoing business operations after deducting operating expenses and taxes.

discontinued_operations.description: The net result of operations that have been discontinued or sold off during the reporting period.

net_income.description: The total profit earned by the company after deducting all expenses, including operating, non-operating, interest, and taxes.

net_loss.description: The total loss incurred by the company after deducting all expenses, including operating, non-operating, interest, and taxes.

FinancialStatement.description: The financial statement detailing the company's financial performance for the given year.
FinancialStatement.title: Financial Statement Object (Mexico)

error.description:
In cases where issues arise during the extraction of financial statements from the fiscal institution, the following error messages may be provided to explain the encountered issues:
  
  - `Unable to validate if the user has an available financial statement for the specified year.`
  - `No available financial statement found for the user for the specified year, preventing data extraction.`
  - `Unable to verify if the user has *conceptos vigentes* for the specified year.`
  - `The fiscal institution provided the financial statement in an unrecognized format.`

year.description: The year of the financial statement.

currency.description: The currency of the financial statement.

EnumInvoiceSatInvoiceType.description:
The fiscal institution's classification of the invoice.

For Mexico's SAT, we return one of the following values:

  - `Egreso`
  - `Ingreso`
  - `Nómina`
  - `Pago`
  - `Traslado`

EnumInvoiceType.description:
The direction of the invoice (from the perspective of the Link owner).
- `OUTFLOW` indicates a sent invoice.
- `INFLOW` indicates a received invoice.

TaxDetailsInvoicesSat.description: General information about the taxes of the invoice.

tax_type.description: The tax type code for this retained tax, as defined by the legal entity in the country.

tax.description: The type of retained tax (for example, ISR, IVA or IEPS).

tax_type.description: The tax type code (TipoFactor) for this transferred tax, as defined by the legal entity in the country.

tax.description: The type of transferred tax (for example, ISR, IVA or IEPS).

EnumInvoiceSatPaymentMethod.description: The payment method code used for this invoice, as defined by the legal entity of the country. - 🇲🇽 Mexico SAT catalog reference article. For Mexico, we return `PUE`, `PPD`, or `null`.

tax_type.description: The tax type code for this retained tax, as defined by the legal entity in the country.

tax.description: The type of retained tax (for example, ISR, IVA or IEPS).

tax_type.description: The tax type code for this transferred tax, as defined by the legal entity in the country.

tax.description: The type of transferred tax (for example, ISR, IVA or IEPS).

description.description: The description of the invoice item (an invoice can have one or more items).

product_identification.description: The identification code of the product or the service, as defined by the legal entity in the country.\n- \U0001F1F2\U0001F1FD Mexico.

quantity.description: The quantity of this invoice item.

unit_code.description: The unit of measure, as defined by the legal entity in the country. \n- \U0001F1F2\U0001F1FD Mexico SAT catalog reference.

unit_description.description: The description of the item, as defined by the legal entity in the country.\n- \U0001F1F2\U0001F1FD Mexico SAT catalog reference.

unit_amount.description: The price of one a singular item.

discount.description: The discount amount applied to this invoice item.

tax_subject_code.description: Indicates what tax this item is subject to, as defined by the legal entity in the country.

identifier_number.description: The identification number of the item, as defined by the seller. This can be used to identify the product or service in the seller's system.

pre_tax_amount.description: The total price for this item before tax is applied (`quantity` x `unit_amount`).

tax_amount.description: The amount of tax for this invoice item (`pre_tax_amount` x `tax_percentage`).

total_amount.description: The total price for this invoice item (`pre_tax_amount` + `tax_amount`).

retained_taxes.description: The retained tax on the invoice item.

transferred_taxes.description: The transferred taxes related to the invoice.

relationship_type.description: The type of relationship between this invoice and the related invoice, as defined by the legal entity in the country. For more information, see our SAT catalog reference article.

related_invoice_identification.description: The SAT ID of the related invoice.

InvoicesPaymentsRelatedDocumentsSat.description: List of all the related deferred invoices affected by the payment.

invoice_identification.description: The fiscal institution's unique ID for the related deferred invoice.

currency.description:
The currency of the related invoice. For example:
    
- 🇧🇷 BRL (Brazilian Real)
- 🇨🇴 COP (Colombian Peso)
- 🇲🇽 MXN (Mexican Peso)
  
  Please note that other currencies other than in the list above may be returned.

payment_method.description: The payment method of the related invoice.

previous_balance.description: The invoice amount before the payment.

amount_paid.description: The amount paid in this installment.

outstanding_balance.description: The amount remaining to be paid.

date.description: ISO-8601 timestamp when the payment was made.

payment_type.description: Payment type code used for this invoice, as defined by the country's legal entity. - 🇲🇽 Mexico SAT catalog reference article

currency.description:
The currency of the payment. For example:

- 🇧🇷 BRL (Brazilian Real)
- 🇨🇴 COP (Colombian Peso)
- 🇲🇽 MXN (Mexican Peso)

Please note that other currencies other than in the list above may be returned.

exchange_rate.description: The `currency` to MXN currency exchange rate when the payment was made.

amount.description: The invoice amount, in the currency of the original invoice.

operation_number.description: The fiscal institution's internal identifier for the operation.

beneficiary_rfc.description: The fiscal ID of the payment beneficiary.

beneficiary_account_number.description: The bank account number of the payment beneficiary.

payer_rfc.description: The fiscal ID of the payment issuer.

payer_account_number.description: The bank account number of the payment issuer.

payer_bank_name.description: The banking institution that was used by the payment issuer.

related_documents.description: A list of all the related deferred invoices affected by the payment.

EnumInvoicePayrollPeriodicity.description:
How often the payroll payment is made.

For Mexico's SAT, we return one of the following values:

  - `DAILY`
  - `WEEKLY`
  - `TENTH_DAY`
  - `FOURTEENTH_DAY`
  - `FIFTEENTH_DAY`
  - `MONTHLY`
  - `BIMONTHLY`
  - `PER_TASK`
  - `COMMISSION`
  - `ONE_OFF`
  - `OTHER_PERIODICITY`

InvoicePayrollEarningsBreakdown.description: A breakdown of the earnings for the payroll payment.

type.description: The type of income. For a full list of possible values, please see the payroll earnings breakdown type table.

taxable_amount.description: The amount of the income that is taxable.

vat_free_amount.description: The amount of the income that is not subject to VAT.

InvoicePayrollTaxDeductions.description: A breakdown of the tax deductions on the payroll payment.

type.description: The type of tax deduction. For a full list of possible values, please see the payroll tax deductions type table.

amount.description: The amount of the tax deduction.

InvoicePayrollOtherPayments.description: A breakdown of other payments for the payroll.

type.description: The type of other payment. For a full list of possible values, please see the payroll other payments type table.

amount.description: The amount of the other payment.

InvoicesPayrollSat.description: Details regarding the payroll payment. Only applicable for payroll invoices.

days.description: The number of days covered by the payment.

type.description: The payroll type, as defined by the legal entity of the country. - 🇲🇽 Mexico SAT catalog reference article

amount.description: The total amount of the payroll payment.

version.description: The version of the payroll object.

date_from.description: The start date of the payment period, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

date_to.description: The end date of the payment period, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

earnings_breakdown.description: A breakdown of the earnings for the payroll payment.

tax_deductions.description: A breakdown of the tax deductions on the payroll payment.

other_payments.description: A breakdown of other payments for the payroll.

InvoiceWarningsSat.description: Object containing information about any warnings related to this invoice.

code.description:
The warning code. Can be one of:

  - `sat_xml_limit_reached`
  - `sat_service_unavailable`
  - `null`

message.description:
The description of the warning. The message will depend on the warning code: `sat_xml_limit_reached`
The daily limit for XML downloads set by SAT was reached so this invoice might be missing data. Please check https://tinyurl.com/yydzhy5d for more information on this error. `sat_service_unavailable`
Downloading invoices details is not available. The SAT portal raised a 503 error.
message.example:
The daily limit for XML downloads set by SAT was reached so this invoice
might be missing data. Please check https://tinyurl.com/yydzhy5d for more
information on this error.

invoice_identification.description: The fiscal institution's unique ID for the invoice.

invoice_date.description: The date of the invoice, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

status.description:
The status of the invoice. Can be either *Vigente* (valid) or *Cancelado*
(cancelled).

sender_id.description: The fiscal ID of the invoice sender

sender_fiscal_regime.description: The tax regime of the sender, as defined by the legal entity in the country.

sender_name.description: The name of the invoice sender.

sender_tax_fraud_status.description:
Indicates whether or not the sender is on SAT's tax fraud list for having submitted incorrect data, having outstanding payments, or having conducted business that is in violation of the fiscal institution's regulations.

SAT updates the tax fraud list every three months.

For more information regarding the reason's a taxpayer can be put on the tax fraud list, please see Article 69 and Article 69-B of Mexico's Código Fiscal de la Federación.

Possible statuses are: - `INVESTIGATING`
The fiscal institution has identified irregularities and open an investigation regarding the taxpayer.
- `DISMISSED`
The fiscal institution has investigated the taxpayer and declared them innocent.
- `CONFIRMED`
The fiscal institution has confirmed that the taxpayer is guilty.
- `OVERTURNED`
The fiscal institution has reassessed a previously confirmed taxpayer and, based on new evidence, has taken the taxpayer off the tax fraud list.
- `NO_TAX_FRAUD_STATUS`
The receiver or sender is not found in the list (in other words, they are complying with the fiscal institution's regulations).

receiver_id.description: The fiscal ID of the invoice receiver.

receiver_postal_code.description: The postal code of the receiver.

receiver_fiscal_regime.description: The tax regime of the receiver, as defined by the legal entity in the country.

receiver_name.description: The name of the invoice receiver.

receiver_tax_fraud_status.description:
Indicates whether or not the receiver is on SAT's tax fraud list for having submitted incorrect data, having outstanding payments, or having conducted business that is in violation of the fiscal institution's regulations.

SAT updates the tax fraud list every three months.

For more information regarding the reason's a taxpayer can be put on the tax fraud list, please see Article 69 and Article 69-B of Mexico's Código Fiscal de la Federación.

Possible statuses are: - `INVESTIGATING`
The fiscal institution has identified irregularities and open an investigation regarding the taxpayer.
- `DISMISSED`
The fiscal institution has investigated the taxpayer and declared them innocent.
- `CONFIRMED`
The fiscal institution has confirmed that the taxpayer is guilty.
- `OVERTURNED`
The fiscal institution has reassessed a previously confirmed taxpayer and, based on new evidence, has taken the taxpayer off the tax fraud list.
- `NO_TAX_FRAUD_STATUS`
The receiver or sender is not found in the list (in other words, they are complying with the fiscal institution's regulations).

cancelation_status.description: If the invoice is cancelled, this field indicates the status of the cancellation.

cancelation_update_date.description: The date of the invoice cancelation, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

certification_date.description: The date of the fiscal certification, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

certification_authority.description: The fiscal ID of the certification provider.

payment_type.description: The payment type code used for this invoice, as defined by the country legal entity. - 🇲🇽 Mexico SAT catalog reference article

payment_type_description.description: *This field has been deprecated. For more information regarding Belvo and deprecation, see our Deprecated fields explanation.*

payment_method_description.description:
*This field has been deprecated. For more information regarding Belvo and deprecation, see our Deprecated fields explanation.*

*The description of the payment method used for this invoice.*

usage.description: The invoice's usage code, as defined by the legal entity of the country. - 🇲🇽 Mexico SAT catalog reference article

version.description: The CFDI version of the invoice.

place_of_issue.description: The postcode of where the invoice was issued.

invoice_details.description: A list of descriptions for each item (purchased product or service provided) in the invoice.

currency.description:
The currency of the invoice. For example:
 
 - 🇧🇷 BRL (Brazilian Real)
 - 🇨🇴 COP (Colombian Peso)
 - 🇲🇽 MXN (Mexican Peso)
 - 🇺🇸 USD (United States Dollar)

subtotal_amount.description: The pretax amount of this invoice (sum of each item's `pre_tax_amount`).

exchange_rate.description: The exchange rate used in this invoice for the currency.

tax_amount.description: The amount of tax for this invoice (sum of each item's `tax_amount`).

discount_amount.description: The total amount discounted in this invoice.

total_amount.description: The total amount of the invoice (`subtotal_amount` + `tax_amount` - `discount_amount`)

payments.description: A list detailing all the invoice payments.

folio.description: The internal control number that the taxpayer assigns to the invoice.

series.description: The series of the invoice, as defined by the taxpayer. This is an optional field used to group invoices.

export_type.description: The export type of the invoice, as defined by the legal entity in the country. For more information, see our SAT catalog reference article.

sender_blacklist_status.description:
*This field has been deprecated. For more information regarding Belvo and deprecation, see our Deprecated fields explanation.*
Please use `sender_tax_fraud_status` instead.

receiver_blacklist_status.description:
*This field has been deprecated. For more information regarding Belvo and deprecation, see our Deprecated fields explanation.*
Please use `receiver_tax_fraud_status` instead.

attach_xml.description: When set to `true`, you will receive the XML invoice in the response.

EnumTaxComplianceStatusOutcome.description:
Indicates whether the taxpayer is complying to all their tax obligations
(`POSITIVE`), if they are not (`NEGATIVE`), or have none to comply to
(`NO_OBLIGATIONS`).

internal_identification.description: The institution’s internal identification number for the document.

pdf.description: Tax compliance status PDF as a binary.

rfc.description: The account holder's RFC (Registro Federal de Contribuyentes) number.

informacion_general.description:
General information on the tax return (year, RFC, return type,
person/company name, and so on).

sueldos_salarios.description:
Details regarding the income information together combined with withheld
taxes.

servicios_profesionales.description:
Details regarding the income and tax information from professional
services provided.

deducciones_personales.description: List of all personal tax deductions.

determinacion_impuesto.description: Details regarding the final tax return.

retenciones.description: Details on the already withheld taxes.

conciliacion_entre_resultado_contable_fi.description:

deducciones_autorizadas.description: Details regarding the legal entity's deductions.

cifras_cierre_ejercicio.description: Details regarding key numbers at the end of the fiscal exercise.

determinacion_del_impuesto_sobre_la_rent.description: Details regarding the final tax return.

ingressos.description:

TaxReturnsMonthlyRequest.title: Monthly Tax Returns
TaxReturnsMonthlyRequest.description: Request body for monthly tax returns

type.description: The type of tax return to return. For monthly tax returns, this field must be set to `monthly`.

TaxReturnsYearlyRequest.title: Yearly Tax Returns
TaxReturnsYearlyRequest.description: Request body for yearly tax returns

type.description:
The type of tax return to return. For yearly tax returns this must be set to `yearly`.

By default, Belvo returns the yearly (annual) tax returns.

year_from.description: The starting year you want to get data for, in `YYYY` format.

year_to.description: The year you want to stop getting data for, in `YYYY` format.

EnumTaxRetentionReceiverNationality.description:
Whether the invoice receiver is a Mexican national or not. If the receiver is not considered a Mexican national, the retained taxes can be calculated differently. Possible values:
  - `NATIONAL`
  - `FOREIGN`

EnumTaxRetentionPaymentStatus.description:
Indicates whether or not the tax has been paid or not. Can be either:
  - `PAID`
  - `PROVISIONED`

RetentionBreakdown.description: A breakdown of the retained taxes

base_amount.description: The base amount that was used to calculate the tax retention.

tax_type.description: Optional attribute to indicate the type of tax withheld for the period or year according to the SAT catalog.

invoice_identification.description: The fiscal institution's unique ID for the invoice that the tax retention relates to.

version.description: The CFDI version of the tax retentions.

code.description: The tax retention code. For more information, see our SAT Catalogs DevPortal article.

issued_at.description: The ISO-8601 timestamp of when the tax retention was issued.

certified_at.description: The ISO-8601 timestamp of when the tax retention was certified.

cancelled_at.description: The ISO-8601 timestamp of when the tax retention was canceled (if applicable).

sender_id.description: The fiscal ID of the invoice sender.

sender_name.description: The name of the invoice sender.

receiver_id.description: The fiscal ID of the invoice receiver.

receiver_name.description: The name of the invoice receiver.

total_invoice_amount.description: The total amount of the invoice that the tax retention relates to.

total_exempt_amount.description: Total amount that is exempt from taxation.

total_taxable_amount.description: The total amount that can be taxed. Calculated as `total_invoice_amount` - `total_exempt_amount`.

retention_breakdown.description: A breakdown of the retained taxes.

xml.description: The tax retention document in XML form.

EnumTaxRetentionType.description:
The type of tax retention in relation to the invoice (from the perspective of the Link owner).

- `OUTFLOW` relates to a tax retention for a sent invoice.
- `INFLOW` related to a tax retention for a received invoice.

rfc.description: The tax payers's identification number (For Mexico, this is the RFC).

curp.description: The tax payers's *Clave Única de Registro de Población* (CURP) number.

name.description: The tax payers's first name.

first_last_name.description: The tax payers's first last name.

second_last_name.description: The tax payers's second last name.

start_operations_date.description: Date when the tax payer commenced taxable commercial activities, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

status_padron.description: Status of the taxpayer in the Federal Register of Taxpayers (RFC). Can be `ACTIVO` or `INACTIVO`.

last_status_change_date.description: Date when `status_padron` was most recently updated, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

commercial_name.description:
The name of the business designated for consumers and the general public.

**Note**: Only applicable for businesses.

social_name.description:
The unique and exclusive name within the national territory that companies
receive for legal or administrative purposes.

**Note**: Only applicable for businesses.

email.description: Contact email address for the tax payer.

phone.description: Contact phone number for the tax payer.

street_one.description: The first street that `street` is located between.

street_two.description: The second street that `street` is located between.

suburb.description: The suburb of the tax payer.

state.description: The state that the address is in.

between_street.description: Additional information about where the `street` is located.

economic_activity.description: The description of the economic activity.

initial_date.description: The start date of the economic activity, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

end_date.description: The end date of the economic activity, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

order.description: The order of the economic activity.

percentage.description: The percentage of the economic activity.

end_date.description: The end date of the regimen, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

initial_date.description: The start date of the regimen, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

regimen.example: Régimen de Ingresos por Dividendos (socios y accionistas)

TaxStatusObligationsSat.description:
Details regarding a business's obligations.

ℹ️ For non-business accounts, this field will return empty.

obligation.example: Declaración informativa de IVA con la anual de ISR

expiration.description: The deadline to fulfill the obligation, as imposed by the tax authority.
expiration.example: Conjuntamente con la declaración anual del ejercicio.

initial_date.description: The date when obligation started, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

end_date.description: The date when obligation ended, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

place_and_date_of_issuance.description: The place and date of that the tax status was issued.
place_and_date_of_issuance.example: TLALPAN , CIUDAD DE MEXICO A 19 DE MARZO DE 2020

official_name.description: The name of the person or business.

id_cif.description: The taxpayer's *Cédula de Identificación Fiscal* (CIF) ID.

economic_activity.description: A list of economic activity objects.

obligations.description:
Details regarding a business's obligations.

ℹ️ For non-business accounts, this field will return empty.

digital_stamp.description: The validation certificate of the document.

digital_stamp_chain.description: A data chain containing the basic structure of a fiscal digital check. For Mexico, this is the *Comprobante Fiscal Digital por Internet* (CFDI).

pdf.description: Tax status PDF as a binary string.

total_amount.description: The total amount of the invoice, including VAT and other taxes or charges.

net_amount.description: The total invoice amount after VAT and other taxes.

vat_amount.description: The total VAT amount of the invoice.

currency.description: The three-letter currency code (ISO-4217) of the invoice.

issue_date.description: The date that the invoice was issued, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

received_at.description: The ISO-8601 timestamp of when the invoice was received.

acknowledged_at.description: The ISO-8601 timestamp of when the invoice was acknowledged as received.

claim_date.description: The date when a claim or dispute was raised about the invoice, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

status.description:
The status of the invoice. Can be either:
  
  - `REGISTERED`
  - `PENDING`
  - `REJECTED`
  - `CANCELLED`

document_code.description: A code that indicates whether the document is a invoice, a credit or debit note, and so on.

category.description: The category of the invoice, according to the institution.

folio.description: The institution's unique code for the invoice.

sender_id.description: The identification number of the sender. For SII Chile, this is the RUT.

sender_name.description: The registered name of the sender.

receiver_id.description: The identification number of the receiver. For SII Chile, this is the RUT.

receiver_name.description: The registered name of the receiver.

type.description: Indicates whether the invoice is an INFLOW or OUTFLOW.

purchase_invoice_details.description: Details regarding the purchase invoice. If the invoice is a sales invoice (`type` = `OUTFLOW`), this field will return `null`.

vat_refundable_amount.description: The amount of VAT paid that is eligible to be claimed back as a tax credit.

vat_non_refundable_amount.description: The amount of VAT paid that cannot be claimed back as a tax credit.

vat_non_refundable_code.description: A code that identifies the reason why the VAT is not recoverable.

net_amount_fixed_assets.description: The net value of the purchased fixed assets.

vat_fixed_assets.description: The VAT value on the purchase of fixed assets.

vat_common_use.description: The VAT that applies to purchases used for both taxable and non-taxable purposes.

tax_non_credit_amount.description: The tax amount that cannot be claimed as a credit.

vat_non_withheld.description: The VAT amount that was not withheld by the purchaser.

tax_exempt_amount.description: The portion of the purchase that is exempt from VAT.

credit_or_debit_note_on_purchase.description: Indicates whether the invoice is linked with a credit or debit note.

tax_cigarettes_amount.description: The total tax amount applied on cigarettes.

tax_cigar_amount.description: The total tax amount applied on cigars.

tax_processed_tobacco_amount.description: The total tax amount applied on processed tobacco.

additional_tax_amount.description: The total tax amount of the additional tax.

additional_tax_rate.description: The tax rate of the additional tax.

additional_tax_code.description: The tax code for the additional tax.

sales_invoice_details.description: Details regarding the sales invoice. If the invoice is a purchase invoice (`type` = `INFLOW`), this field will return `null`.

construction_sector_tax_credit.description: The amount of tax credit applicable for construction companies.

tax_free_trade_zone_amount.description: Tax applicable for transactions in free trade zones.

container_deposit_guarantee.description: Refers to deposits or guarantees on containers, if applicable.

is_free_of_charge.description: Indicated whether or not this sale was made at no cost (for example, the invoice is for promotional material, periodic free-of-charge resupplies, and similar).

periodic_billing_type.description: Marks if the invoice is for periodic services.

non_billable_amount.description: The portion of the transaction that is not billable.

total_amount_for_period.description: The total amount for a specific period, often used for periodic billing.

domestic_transportation_amount.description: The total amount spent on domestic transportation.

international_transportation_amount.description: The total amount spent on international transportation.

branch_code.description: The code of the fiscal branch where the sales invoice was issued.

tax_exempt_amount.description: The portion of the sale that is exempt from VAT.

credit_or_debit_note_on_purchase.description: Indicates whether the invoice is linked with a credit or debit note.

additional_tax_code.description: The tax code for the additional tax.

additional_tax_rate.description: The tax rate of the additional tax.

additional_tax_amount.description: The total tax amount of the additional tax.

vat_partially_withheld.description: The amount of VAT partially withheld.

vat_non_withheld.description: The amount of VAT that was not withheld.

vat_sales.description: The VAT amount corresponding to the seller's own sales.

vat_third_party.description: VAT amount related to third-party sales if acting as an intermediary.

vat_past_due.description: VAT that is accounted for or paid after the due date.

invoice_settlement_sender_id.description: The RUT of the entity that issued the settlement for the invoice.

invoice_settlement_net_commission.description: The net amount of commission in the invoice settlement.

invoice_settlement_exempt_commission.description: The portion of the commission in the invoice settlement that is exempt from tax.

invoice_settlement_vat_commission.description: VAT charged on the commission amount in the invoice settlement.

reference_document_type.description: Indicates the type of document that this invoice refers to or is linked with.

reference_document_folio.description: The folio number of the document referred to.

foreign_recipient_id.description: The identification number of a foreign individual.

foreign_recipient_nationality.description: The nationality of the foreign individual.

summary_invoice_details.description: Details regarding the summary of `BOLETA_ELECTRONICA` or `COMPROBANTE_PAGO` invoices.

month.description: The year and month of the invoices, in `YYYY-MM` format.

updated_at.description: The ISO-8601 timestamp of when the list of invoices was last updated.

total_documents.description: The total number of invoices in the summary.

tax_exempt_amount.description: The total invoice value (from all invoices in the summary) that is exempt from VAT.

tax_status_sii_entity_details.description: Details regarding the fiscal entity's (key dates and identification information).

incorporation_date.description: The date that the fiscal entity was incorporated, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

start_date.description: The date that the fiscal entity started operating, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

end_date.description: The date that the fiscal entity ceased operations, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format. If the entity is still operating, this field will return `null`

document_id_type.description: The type of document ID that the fiscal entity has. For Chile, this will be the `RUT`.

document_id_number.description: The document ID number of the fiscal entity.

name.description: The name of the fiscal entity.

tax_status_sii_address.description: Details regarding the address of the fiscal entity.

type.description:
The type of address. Can be either:

  - `PRIMARY` (*domicilio*)
  - `SECONDARY` (*sucursal*)
  - `MAILING_ADDRESS` (*DOM. POSTAL*)
  - `NOTIFICATION_ADDRESS` (*DOM. URBANO_VALIDO_NOTIFICACIONES*)

date.description: The date that the address was added to the fiscal entity's records, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

address.description: The address of the fiscal entity.

tax_status_sii_emails.description: Details regarding the email addresses of the fiscal entity.

type.description:
The type of email. Can be either:

- `CONTACT` (*Correo electrónico de contacto*)
- `NOTIFICATION` (*Correo electrónico para notificaciones*)
- `OTHER`.

email.description: The email address of the fiscal entity.

tax_status_sii_phone.description: Details regarding the phone numbers of the fiscal entity.

type.description:
The type of phone number. Can be either:
  
  - `LANDLINE`
  - `MOBILE`
  - `OTHER`

number.description: The phone number of the fiscal entity.

tax_status_sii_economic_activity.description: Details regarding the economic activity of the fiscal entity.

type.description: The overall economic activity type, according to Servicio de Impuestos Internos (SII).

activity.description: The specific economic activity, according to Servicio de Impuestos Internos (SII).

code.description: The economic activity code, according to Servicio de Impuestos Internos (SII).

tax_category.description: The tax category of the economic activity, according to Servicio de Impuestos Internos (SII).

vat_affected.description: Indicates whether the economic activity is VAT-affected.

start_date.description: The date that the fiscal entity started this economic activity, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

tax_status_sii_legal_representative.description: Details regarding the legal representatives of the fiscal entity.

is_current.description: Indicates whether the legal representative is the current legal representative of the fiscal entity.

name.description: The name of the legal representative.

document_id_type.description: The type of document ID of the legal representative. For Chile, this will be always set to `RUT`.

document_id_number.description: The document ID number of the legal representative. For Chile, this will be the RUT number.

start_date.description: The date that the legal representative started representing the fiscal entity, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

end_date.description: The date that the legal representative ceased representing the fiscal entity, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format. If the legal representative is still representing the fiscal entity, this field will return `null`.

tax_status_sii_equity_holder.description: Detaiuls regarding the equity holders of the fiscal entity.

is_current.description: Indicates whether the equity holder is currently active.

name.description: The name of the equity holder.

document_id_type.description: The type of document ID of the equity holder. For Chile, this will be always set to `RUT`.

document_id_number.description: The document ID number of the equity holder. For Chile, this will be the RUT number.

inactive.description: Indicates whether the equity holder is currently inactive.

start_date.description: The date that the equity holder started holding equity in the fiscal entity, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

end_date.description: The date that the equity holder ceased holding equity in the fiscal entity, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format. If the equity holder is still holding equity in the fiscal entity, this field will return `null`.

capital_contributed.description: The amount of capital contributed by the equity holder.

capital_contribution_outstanding.description: The amount of capital contribution outstanding by the equity holder.

ownership_share.description: The percentage of ownership share of the equity holder.

profit_share.description: The percentage of profit share of the equity holder.

tax_status_sii_company_stake.description: Details regarding the company stakes of the fiscal entity.

name.description: The name of the entity that this fiscal entity.

document_id_type.description: The type of document ID of the business. For Chile, this will be always set to `RUT`.

document_id_number.description: The document ID number of the business. For Chile, this will be the RUT number.

inactive.description: Indicates whether the business is currently active.

start_date.description: The date that the company started holding equity in the fiscal entity, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

end_date.description: The date that the company holder ceased holding equity in the fiscal entity, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format. If the equity holder is still holding equity in the fiscal entity, this field will return `null`.

capital_contributed.description: The amount of capital contributed by the company.

capital_contribution_outstanding.description: The amount of capital contribution outstanding by the company.

ownership_share.description: The percentage of ownership share of the company.

profit_share.description: The percentage of profit share of the company.

tax_status_sii_regime.description: Details regarding the tax regime of the fiscal entity.

type.description: The tax regime type, as defined by the Servicio de Impuestos Internos (SII).

start_date.description: The date that the fiscal entity started this tax regime, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

tax_status_sii_authorized_tax_document.description: Details regarding an authorized tax document for the fiscal entity.

type.description: The type of authorized tax document, as defined by the Servicio de Impuestos Internos (SII).
type.example: CONTABILIDAD EN HOJAS SUELTAS CON NRO.UN

document_limit.description: The maximum number of documents that can be issued under this authorization.

authorization_date.description: The date that the tax document and limit were established, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

tax_status_sii_property_tax_liabilities.description: Details regarding the tax liabilities of a property that the entity is associated with.

property_id.description: The unique identifier of the property, according to the Servicio de Impuestos Internos (SII).

district.description: The district where the property is located.

type.description: The type of property associated with the tax liability.

overdue_tax_payments.description: A list of overdue tax payments for the property.

year.description: The year for which the tax payment is overdue.

installment.description: The instalment number of the overdue tax payment.

due_date.description: The due date of the overdue tax payment, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

amount_due.description: The amount due for the overdue tax payment.

scheduled_tax_payments.description: A list of scheduled tax payments for the property.

year.description: The year for which the tax payment is scheduled.

installment.description: The instalment number of the scheduled tax payment.

due_date.description: The due date of the scheduled tax payment, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

amount_due.description: The amount due for the scheduled tax payment.

tax_status_sii_fiscal_office.description: Details regarding fiscal office where the fiscal entity is registered.

name.description: The name of the fiscal office where the fiscal entity is registered.

address.description: The address of the fiscal office where the fiscal entity is registered.

addresses.description: An array of addresses for the fiscal entity.

emails.description: An array of email addresses for the fiscal entity.

phone_numbers.description: An array of phone numbers for the fiscal entity.

economic_activities.description: An array of economic activities for the fiscal entity.

legal_representative.description: An array of legal representatives for the fiscal entity.

equity_holders.description: An array of equity holders for the fiscal entity.

company_partnership_stakes.description: An array of company partnership stakes for the fiscal entity.

regimes.description: A list of tax regimes for the fiscal entity.

authorized_tax_documents.description: A list of authorized tax documents for the fiscal entity.

property_tax_liabilities.description: A list of tax liabilities of a property that the entity is associated with.

full_name.description: The full name of the individual.

document_id_type.description: The type of document ID of the individual. For Chile, this will be always set to `RUT`.

document_id_number.description: The document ID number of the individual. For Chile, this will be the RUT number.

debt_data_last_update.description: The date when the debt data was last updated, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

currency.description: The currency of the debts. For Chile, this will be the `CLP`.

total.description: The total amount of debt including current, delinquent, severely delinquent, and defaulted debts.

current.description: The amount of debt that is currently outstanding but not past due.

delinquent.description: The amount of debt that is 30-59 days past due.

severely_delinquent.description: The amount of debt that is 60-89 days past due.

defaulted.description: The amount of debt that is 90 days past due.

direct_debts.description: A list of debts that are directly atttribued to the individual.

financial_institution.description: The name of the financial institution where the debt is held.

credit_type.description: The type of credit issued by the financial institution. For example, `Vivienda`, `Comercial`, `Consumo`, or `Otro`.

amount.description: The total amount of the debt at the financial institution.

current.description: The current outstanding amount of the debt at the financial institution.

delinquent.description: The amount of debt that is 30-59 days past due.

severely_delinquent.description: The amount of debt that is 60-89 days past due.

defaulted.description: The amount of debt that is 90 days past due.

indirect_debts.description: List of indirect debts from financial institutions.

financial_institution.description: Name of the financial institution providing the indirect debt.

credit_type.description: The type of credit issued by the financial institution. For example, `Vivienda`, `Comercial`, `Consumo`, or `Otro`.

amount.description: The total amount of the debt at the financial institution.

current.description: The current outstanding amount of the debt at the financial institution.

delinquent.description: The amount of debt that is 30-59 days past due.

severely_delinquent.description: The amount of debt that is 60-89 days past due.

defaulted.description: The amount of debt that is 90 days past due.

credit_lines.description: List of credit lines (such as credit cards) available to the individual.

financial_institution.description: The name of the financial institution providing the credit line.

direct_amount.description: The amount of direct credit available.

indirect_amount.description: The amount of indirect credit available.

other_credits.description: List of other credits (such as guarantee notes, foreign credit, and so on) available to the individual.

financial_institution.description: The name of the financial institution providing the credit.

direct_amount.description: The amount of direct credit available.

indirect_amount.description: The amount of indirect credit available.

count.description: The total number of results in your Belvo account.

next.description:
The URL to next page of results. Each page consists of up to 100 items. If there are not enough results for an additional page, the value is `null`.

In our documentation example, we use `{endpoint}` as a placeholder value. In production, this value will be replaced by the actual endpoint you are currently using (for example, `accounts` or `owners`).

previous.description:
The URL to the previous page of results. If there is no previous page, the
value is `null`.

id.description: Belvo's unique ID to reference the institution.

active.description: Indicates whether this institution is available for use or not.

institution_type.description: The type of institution. Can be either `BUSINESS` or `INDIVIDUAL`.

name.description: The name of the institution, as designated by Belvo.

display_name.description: The customer-facing name of the institution.

legal_entity_name.description: The name of the legal entity of the institution, as registered with the relevant regulatory authority. Only applicable for 🇧🇷 Brazil OFPI.

website.description: The URL of the institution's website.

logo.description: The URL of the institution's logo.

icon_logo.description: The URL of the institution's icon logo.

text_logo.description: The URL of the institution's text logo.

primary_color.description: The primary color on the institution's website.

country.description: The country that the institution is located in. For Brazil, this is always set to `BRA`.

form_fields.description: This field is not applicable for OFPI and will return an empty array.

sort_priority.description: Number that represents the order in which the institution should be displayed in an application, with `1` being the highest.

description.description: A brief description of the insitution.
description.example: Simple, transparent and secure: Wakanda Bank is the leading financial technology company in Latin America.

401UnauthorizedError.title: Unauthorized Error
401UnauthorizedError.description: This error occurs when you try to make an API call using incorrect Belvo API credentials (either your secret key or secret password, or both, are incorrect).

code.description: A unique error code (`authentication_failed`) that allows you to classify and handle the error programmatically.

message.description:
A short description of the error.


For `authentication_failed` errors, the description is:

  - `Invalid Secret Keys`.
message.example: Invalid Secret Keys

status_updated_at.description: The ISO-8601 timestamp of when the status of the Charge was last updated.

status.description:
The current status of the Charge. Can be one of the following values:

  - `PENDING`
  - `SCHEDULED`
  - `SETTLED`
  - `CANCELED`
  - `FAILED`

status_reason_code.description: The reason code for the current status of the Charge, if applicable.

amount.description: The amount of the Charge.

date.description: The original date of the Charge.

end_to_end_id.description: The end-to-end ID of the Charge. This is a unique identifier for the transaction that can be used to track it across different systems.

statement_description.description: The description that will appear on the customer's bank statement (if provided).

beneficiary.description: Information about the beneficiary of the Charge.

bank_account.description: Information about the beneficiary's bank account.

400ValidationError.title: Validation Error
400ValidationError.description: This error occurs when the parameters provided did not match the expected fields or the item you are trying to create is already in our database, leading to a field validation errors.

code.description: A unique error code (`null`, `does_not_exist`, `required`, `already_registered`, `invalid_choice`, `max_length`, `min_length`, `blank`, `null`, `cancellation_error`, `idempotency_key_invalid`) that allows you to classify and handle the error programmatically.

message.description:
A short description of the error.


The description can be (among others):

  - `This field is required.`
  - `Object with name=narnia does not exist.`
  - `This field may not be null.`
  - `This field may not be blank.`
  - `This customer is already registered`
  - `Ensure this field has at least 2 characters.`
  - `Ensure this field has no more than 4 characters.`
  - `Entered value is not valid.`
  - `You must set all required fields: username, password, username_type.`
  - `Payment Intent cannot be canceled because it is not SCHEDULED.`
  - `Payment Intent cannot be canceled as the cutoff time (23:59:00) has passed.`
  - `The provided idempotency key is invalid.`
message.example: This field is required.

field.description:
Name of the field where the error was encountered.

> **Note**: This field is only present when the error is related to a specific field.

PaymentLinkCallbackUrlsResponse.title: Payment Link Callback URLs
PaymentLinkCallbackUrlsResponse.description: The URLs that the user should be redirected to. **Note:** This field will return an empty object if your integration only generates payment links through the Belvo Dashboard.

cancel.description: The URL that the user should be redirected to if they decide to cancel the payment process or if an error occurs.

success.description: The URL that the user should be redirected to when they complete the payment process successfully.

EnumPaymentLinksStatus.description: The current status of the payment link. Can be either: - `ACTIVE` meaning that the payment intent's status is either `REQUIRES_PAYMENT_METHOD`, `REQUIRES_ACTION`, or `PROCESSING`. - `INACTIVE` meaning that the payment intent's status is either `SUCCEEDED` or `FAILED`. **Note:** You can retrieve the complete payment intent by using our Get details of a payment link request.

payment_url.description: The URL for the hosted-widget that will guide your user through the payments process.

access_token.description: The Belvo-generated access token for the payment link. **Note:** You'll need the `access_token` to make Get details for a payment link requests.

payment_intent.description: Belvo's unique ID for the payment intent. You can retrieve the complete payment intent by using our Get details of a payment link request.

updated_at.description: The ISO-8601 timestamp of when the payment link was last updated.

expires_at.description: The ISO-8601 timestamp of when the payment link is set to expire.

  - `open_finance_biometric_pix`: For biometric payments using the PIX network.

cancel.description: The URL that the user should be redirected to if they decide to cancel the payment process or if an error occurs. **Note:** Not required if your integration only generates payment links through the Belvo Dashboard.

success.description: The URL that the user should be redirected to when they complete the payment process successfully. **Note:** Not required if your integration only generates payment links through the Belvo Dashboard.

EnumPaymentLinkProvider.description:
**Note**: This field has been deprecated and will be removed from the API in the future.

*The provider used for the payment link.*

amount.description:
Amount to be paid by your customer. For OFPI, you can send through numbers with up to two decimal points, separated by a `.` period. For example: `1234.12`

**Note:** You can send through this value either as a string or an float. Regardless of the type you choose to send the `amount` as, Belvo returns a string with two decimal points, separated by a period ( `.`). For example, `1234.12`.

customer.description: Belvo's unique ID to reference the customer.

description.description: A human-readable description of the payment.

statement_description.description:
A description that will appear on the customer's bank statement (recommended).


> **Note**: If you do not use the `statement_description` parameter, the `description` value will be used as the statement description.

allowed_payment_method_types.description: A list of payment method types allowed in this payment intent. For OFPI, this value must be set to `open_finance`.

expires_in.description:
The payment link expiration time. It allows the following formats to be sent through:

  - whole number + `m` for x amount of minutes. For example: `15m` for 15 minutes.
  - whole number + `h` for x amount of hours. For example: `12h` for 12 hours.
  - whole number + `d` for x amount of days. For example: `7d` for 7 days.

  ℹ️ The minimum expiration time allowed for a payment link is `1m` (1 minute) and the maximum is `7d` (7 days).

⚠️ **Note**: You can only provide up to 50 keys (keys can have up to 50 characters each and each value can be up to 500 characters). We do not support nested objects, only ASCII values.

  - `MONDAY`
  - `TUESDAY`

occurrences.description:
The number of times the payment should repeat. 

>**Note**: You must schedule at least `2` occurrences and no more than `24`.

>**Note**: The dates must be at least 1 day in the future and no more than 720 days in the future.

A description of the custom recurring payment that will display to your user when they are redirected to their bank to accept the payment.

> **Note**: We highly recommend that this message be in Brazilian Portuguese, and that it clearly explains the purpose as well as recurring nature of the payment.

settlement_date.description:
The `settlement_date` field indicates the date on which a scheduled payment (charge) is planned to be settled. This field is relevant in various states of the charge's lifecycle:

  - Scheduled Charges: When a charge has the status `SCHEDULED`, this field represents the planned settlement date.
  - Completed Charges: When a charge has the status `SUCCEEDED`, this field reflects the date that the payment was made.
  - Failed or Canceled Charges: When a charge has the status `CANCELED` or `FAILED`, this field will still contain the originally calculated settlement date, indicating when the charge was intended to be settled.


> **Note**: The `settlement_date` does not change based on the success or failure of the charge. It consistently reflects the original planned settlement date.

expires_at.description: The ISO-8601 timestamp of when the payment link is set to expire.

scheduled_single-2.title: Single
scheduled_single-2.description: Schedule a single (one-off) payment in the future.

single.description: Schedule a single (one-off) payment in the future.

date.description:
The date the one-off scheduled payment should be made, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

>**Note**: The date must be at least 1 day in the future and no more than 720 days in the future.

start_date.description:
The date the recurring daily payment should start on, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

>**Note**: The `start_date` must be at least 1 day in the future.

occurrences.description:
The number of times the payment should repeat. 

>**Note**: You must schedule at least `2` occurrences and no more than `60`.

start_date.description:
The date the recurring weekly payment should start on, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

>**Note**: The `start_date` must correspond to the first `day_of_week` specified and be at least 1 day in the future.

day_of_week.description:
The day of the week the payment should be made. Can be one of the following values:

  - `MONDAY`
  - `TUESDAY`
  - `WEDNESDAY`
  - `THURSDAY`
  - `FRIDAY`
  - `SATURDAY`
  - `SUNDAY`

occurrences.description:
The number of times the payment should repeat. 

>**Note**: You must schedule at least `2` occurrences and no more than `60`.

start_date.description:
The date the recurring monthly payment should start on, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

>**Note**: The `start_date` must correspond to the first `day_of_month` specified and be at least 1 day in the future.

day_of_month.description: The day of the month the payment should be made. Can be any integer between `1` and `31`.

occurrences.description:
The number of times the payment should repeat. 

>**Note**: You must schedule at least `2` occurrences and no more than `24`.

dates.description:
The unique dates the recurring payment should be made, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

>**Note**: The dates must be at least 1 day in the future and no more than 720 days in the future.

items.description: The date of the payment, in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

description.description:
A description of the custom recurring payment that will display to your user when they are redirected to their bank to accept the payment.

> **Note**: We highly recommend that this message be in Brazilian Portuguese, and that it clearly explains the purpose as well as recurring nature of the payment.
description.example: Os pagamentos ocorrerão a cada três dias até a data final (30.09.2024)

schedule-2.title: Schedule a payment
schedule-2.description: Details regarding the scheduled payment (optional). For more information on how to schedule payments, please see our dedicated OFPI Scheduled Payments guide.

CreatePaymentIntentPixKeys.title: Pix Keys (With Existing Customer)
CreatePaymentIntentPixKeys.description:
Create a Payment Intent using a Pix Key as the beneficiary details and using a previously created customer.

Note: When using the Pix Keys method, you will need to make an additional PATCH request.

amount.description: Amount to be paid by your customer. You can send through numbers with up to two decimal points, separated by a `.` period. For example: `1234.12`

customer.description: Belvo's unique ID to reference your previously created customer.

description.description: A human-readable description of the payment.

statement_description.description:
A description that will appear on the customer's bank statement (recommended).


> **Note**: If you do not use the `statement_description` parameter, the `description` value will be used as the statement description.

allowed_payment_method_types.description: A list of payment method types allowed in this payment intent. For Brazil (OFPI), this value must be set to `open_finance`.

payment_method_details.description: Details about the OFPI payment method.

confirm.description:
Boolean that confirms the payment intent.

**Note:** Sending this parameter set to `true` confirms the payment intent.

metadata.description:
Optional and customizable object where you can provide any additional key-value pairs for your internal purposes. For example, an internal reference number for the payment intent.


⚠️ **Note**: You can only provide up to 50 keys (keys can have up to 50 characters each and each value can be up to 500 characters). We do not support nested objects, only ASCII values.

PaymentMethodInformationPixKeysInitial.title: Initial
PaymentMethodInformationPixKeysInitial.description: Information about the Pix Key payment method at the time of payment intent creation. It will only include the `pix_key_details` property, which you need to show your user to confirm that their details are correct. After they confirm and you send through the PATCH request, this object will be populated with additional properties (see the **Confirmed** schema).

pix_key_details.description: Details about the Pix Key used for the payment. You need to display this information to your user for them to confirm that the details are correct. After they confirm, you can send a PATCH request to confirm the Payment Intent.

identifier.description: The masked identifier of the owner.

name.description: The name of the Pix Key holder.

PaymentMethodInformationPixKeysConfirmed.title: Confirmed
PaymentMethodInformationPixKeysConfirmed.description: Information about the Pix Key payment method after the payment intent has been confirmed via a PATCH request.

provider_request_id.description: Unique ID for the payment, as sent by the provider.

redirect_url.description: The URL that redirects the payer to their institution's website to authorize the payment.

end_to_end_id.description: A unique ID for the transaction in the Brazil's PIX payment system.

settlement_date.description:
The `settlement_date` field indicates the date on which a scheduled payment (charge) is planned to be settled. This field is relevant in various states of the charge's lifecycle:

  - Scheduled Charges: When a charge has the status `SCHEDULED`, this field represents the planned settlement date.
  - Completed Charges: When a charge has the status `SUCCEEDED`, this field reflects the date that the payment was made.
  - Failed or Canceled Charges: When a charge has the status `CANCELED` or `FAILED`, this field will still contain the originally calculated settlement date, indicating when the charge was intended to be settled.


> **Note**: The `settlement_date` does not change based on the success or failure of the charge. It consistently reflects the original planned settlement date.

pix_key_details.description: Details about the Pix key used for the payment.

identifier.description: The masked identifier of the owner.

name.description: The name of the Pix key holder.

payer_institution.description: Unique identifier for the payer's institution.

pix_key.description: The Pix key associated with the beneficiary of the transaction. Can be an email, phone number, CPF/CNPJ, or a random key.

updated_at.description: The ISO-8601 timestamp of when the status of the charge was last updated.

customer.description: Belvo's unique ID for the customer that the charge was created for.

status.description:
The current status of the charge. Can be one of the following values:

  - `CANCELED`
  - `PENDING`
  - `SCHEDULED`
  - `SUCCEEDED`
  - `FAILED`
  - `PARTIAL`

amount.description: The amount of the charge.

currency.description: The currency of the amount paid. For 🇧🇷 Brazil, the value must be `BRL` (Brazilian Real).

description.description: The description of the payment.

statement_description.description: The description that will appear on the customer's bank statement (if provided).

beneficiary.description: Belvo's unique ID used to identify the beneficiary’s bank account. In the case that the beneficiary is a Pix Key, this field will be `null`.

payment_method_type.description: Selected payment method type. For 🇧🇷 Brazil's OFPI, the value must be `open_finance`.

transactions.description: For Pix Key payments, this will be an empty array.

failure_code.description: Error code that explains the reason behind a payment being unsuccessful (if applicable).
